--- title: "Migration in Bangalore" author: "Mekhala Kumar" description: "Final Project" date: "08/31/2022" format: html: toc: true code-copy: true code-tools: true categories: - final - migration --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(readxl) library(ggplot2) knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE) ``` ::: ## Read in data ### Briefly describe the data The data being used is Indian Census Data for the year 2011 and district of Bangalore. There are several tables in the Census such as population, languages spoken, education and migration.\ For this project, I am using the population data and one of the migration tables (D3). The Indian Census has two definitions of migrations: 1)a person who lives in area other than their place of birth and 2)a person who changed their place of residence. The D3 Census table uses the second definition, it also includes information about the number of years they have resided in the area and reason why they migrated. I specifically chose the dataset for Karnataka(the receiving state) and filtered it for Bangalore; hence the receiving area is Bangalore and the various sending states/areas are looked into.\ ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Removing the top few rows which have just the table names and renaming columns mig <- read_excel("_data/Mekhala's data/DS-2900-D03-MDDS.XLSX",skip=5,col_names = c("tab_name","state_code","dist_code","area","res","res_time","last_res","last_res_type","tot_t","tot_m","tot_f","work_t","work_m","work_f","busi_t","busi_m","busi_f","educ_t","educ_m","educ_f","mar_t","mar_m","mar_f","afterbirth_t","afterbirth_m","afterbirth_f","withhh_t","withhh_m","withhh_f","others_t","others_m","others_f"))%>%filter(area=="Bangalore") mig_org<-mig dim(mig) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1875 32 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #there are 45 unique values for last place of residence last_residence_temp1 <- unique(mig$last_res) last_residence_temp1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Total" [2] "Last residence within India" [3] "Within the state of enumeration but outside the place of enumeration" [4] "Elsewhere in the district of enumeration" [5] "In other districts of the state of enumeration" [6] "States in India beyond the state of enumeration" [7] "Jammu & Kashmir" [8] "Himachal Pradesh" [9] "Punjab" [10] "Chandigarh" [11] "Uttarakhand" [12] "Haryana" [13] "NCT of Delhi" [14] "Rajasthan" [15] "Uttar Pradesh" [16] "Bihar" [17] "Sikkim" [18] "Arunachal Pradesh" [19] "Nagaland" [20] "Manipur" [21] "Mizoram" [22] "Tripura" [23] "Meghalaya" [24] "Assam" [25] "West Bengal" [26] "Jharkhand" [27] "Odisha" [28] "Chhattisgarh" [29] "Madhya Pradesh" [30] "Gujarat" [31] "Daman & Diu" [32] "Dadra & Nagar Haveli" [33] "Maharashtra" [34] "Andhra Pradesh" [35] "Karnataka" [36] "Goa" [37] "Lakshadweep" [38] "Kerala" [39] "Tamil Nadu" [40] "Puducherry" [41] "Andaman & Nicobar Islands" [42] "Last residence outside India" [43] "Countries in Asia beyond India" [44] "Other Countries" [45] "Unclassifiable" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} print(summarytools::dfSummary(mig, varnumbers = FALSE, plain.ascii = FALSE, style = "grid", graph.magnif = 0.70, valid.col = FALSE), method = 'render', table.classes = 'table-condensed') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #recoding values mig<-mutate(mig,last_res=recode(last_res,`Within the state of enumeration but outside the place of enumeration`= "Intrastate", `Elsewhere in the district of enumeration`= "Intradistrict", `In other districts of the state of enumeration` = "Interdistrict", `States in India beyond the state of enumeration`= "Interstate")) #This part just shows why we can't remove totals from last place of residence #removing the obvious totals, does this by mistake remove something i want?- yes it does remove as can be seen below mig3<-mig%>%filter(!str_detect(res, "Total"))%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Total"))%>%select(-c(9:11)) mig3_sub<-mig3%>%filter(res_time!="All durations of residence") #there are 40 unique values- when you remove the totals simply, certain data gets removed altogether like other counties, unclassifiable,etc #so the minus of totals in the row does not make sense to use last_residence_temp2 <- unique(mig3_sub$last_res) last_residence_temp2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Last residence within India" "Intrastate" [3] "Intradistrict" "Interdistrict" [5] "Interstate" "Jammu & Kashmir" [7] "Himachal the last_res_type column should not be removed mig3_sub2<-mig%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res, "Total"))%>%select(-c(9:11)) mig3_sub2<-mig%>%filter(res_time!="All durations of residence") last_residence_temp3 <- unique(mig3_sub2$last_res) last_residence_temp3 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Total" "Last residence within India" [3] "Intrastate" "Intradistrict" [5] #if i use this-undercount mig<-mig%>%filter(!str_detect(res, "Total"))%>%filter(res_time!="All durations of residence") #if i use this- overcount #mig<-mig%>%filter(!str_detect(res, "Total")) #if i use this-overcount #mig<-mig%>%filter(res_time!="All durations of residence") #selecting all the aggregates mig_filt<-mig%>%filter(last_res=="Interstate"|last_res=="Intradistrict"|last_res=="Interdistrict"|last_res=="Countries in Asia beyond India"|last_res=="Other Countries"|last_res=="Unclassifiable")%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Rural"))%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Urban")) #something is getting cut out totals<-mig_filt%>%group_by(last_res)%>% summarise(total_people = sum(tot_t)) #COMPARISON mig_org<-mutate(mig_org,last_res=recode(last_res,`Within the state of enumeration but outside the place of enumeration`= "Intrastate", `Elsewhere in the district of enumeration`= "Intradistrict", `In other districts of the state of enumeration` = "Interdistrict", `States in India beyond the state of enumeration`= "Interstate")) mig_org_totals_data<-mig_org%>%filter(res=="Total")%>%filter(res_time=="All durations of residence")%>%filter(last_res=="Interstate"|last_res=="Intradistrict"|last_res=="Interdistrict"|last_res=="Countries in Asia beyond India"|last_res=="Other Countries"|last_res=="Unclassifiable")%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Rural"))%>%filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Urban")) mig_org_totals<-mig_org_totals_data%>%group_by(last_res)%>% summarise(total_people = sum(tot_t)) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Troubleshooting mig_org %>% filter(last_res_type=="Total")%>% group_by(last_res)%>% filter(last_res=="Interstate"|last_res=="Intradistrict"|last_res=="Interdistrict"|last_res=="Countries in Asia beyond India"|last_res=="Other Countries"|last_res=="Unclassifiable")%>% summarise(total_people = sum(tot_t)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 2 last_res total_people 1 Countries in Asia beyond India 82550 2 Interdistrict 8310062 3 Interstate 6432766 4 Intradistrict 3404674 5 Other Countries 86928 6 Unclassifiable 10972 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mig_org<-mutate(mig_org,last_res=recode(last_res,`Within the state of enumeration but outside the place of enumeration`= "Intrastate", `Elsewhere in the district of enumeration`= "Intradistrict", `In other districts of the state of enumeration` = "Interdistrict", `States in India beyond the state of enumeration`= "Interstate")) mig_org%>% filter(res=="Total")%>% filter(res_time=="All durations of residence")%>% filter(last_res=="Interstate"|last_res=="Intradistrict"|last_res=="Interdistrict"|last_res=="Countries in Asia beyond India"|last_res=="Other Countries"|last_res=="Unclassifiable")%>% filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Rural"))%>% filter(!str_detect(last_res_type, "Urban")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 32 tab_name state_code dist_c…¹ area res mig_group ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1,000 × 33 # Groups: "last_res" [1] tab_n…¹ state…² dist_…³ area res res_t…⁴ last_…⁵ last_…⁶ tot_t tot_m tot_f 1 D0603 29 572 Bang… Rural Durati… Total Total 52414 30180 22234 2 D0603 29 572 Bang… Rural Durati… Last r… Total 52080 29980 22100 3 D0603 29 572 Bang… Rural Durati… Last r… Rural 33456 19546 13910 4 D0603 29 572 Bang… Durati… Intrad… Urban 7046 3642 3404 # … with 990 more rows, 22 more variables: work_t , work_m , # work_f , busi_t , busi_m , busi_f , educ_t , # educ_m , educ_f , mar_t , mar_m , mar_f , # afterbirth_t , afterbirth_m , afterbirth_f , withhh_t , # withhh_m , withhh_f , others_t , others_m , # others_f , `"last_res"` , and abbreviated variable names # ¹​tab_name, ²​state_code, ³​dist_code, ⁴​res_time, ⁵​last_res, ⁶​last_res_type # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mig_pivot2<-pivot_longer(mig, 12:32, names_to = "Reason for Migration", values_to = "Number of People") mig_pivot2<-pivot_wider(mig_pivot2, names_from=7:8, values_from=9:11) mig_pivot3<-mig%>%select(-c(9:11)) mig_pivot3<-pivot_wider(mig_pivot3, names_from=7:8, values_from=9:29) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #mig3<-mig3%>%select(tab_name,state_code,dist_code,area,res,res_time,last_res,last_residence,everything()) #mig3=subset(mig3,select=-c(7)) #dim(mig3) #am i using this correctly? like does it make sense in this context mig3%>% summarise(across(c(res_time,last_residence), n_distinct)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error in `summarise()`: ! Problem while computing `..1 = across(c(res_time, last_residence), n_distinct)`. Caused by error in `across()`: ! Can't subset columns that don't exist. ✖ Column `last_residence` doesn't exist. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #things to be removed- all durations of residence, total in the total, rural, urban column? not sure #stuff that are aggregates- place of enum-res, #keep the specifics or remove them? #how to print more values in summarytools ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pop <- read_excel("_data/Mekhala's data/A-1_NO_OF_VILLAGES_TOWNS_HOUSEHOLDS_POPULATION_AND_AREA (1).xlsx",skip=4,col_names=c("state_code","dist_code","sub_dist_code","type_of_region","name","reg_type","num_village_inhabit","num_village_uninhabit","num_town","num_hh","pop_t","pop_m","pop_f","area_region","pop_density"))%>%filter(name=="Bangalore") ``` ::: ## Tidy Data In the last_res( last place of residence variable), place of enumeration refers to the district where the person's details were recorded. The state of enumeration is the state that the information was recorded. Since it can be confusing to understand, the values are being renamed as intrastate, intradistict, interdistrict and interstate to give an indication of the type of migration that was undertaken. Recode was used because only certain observations needed to be changed and using case_When() instead would result in the unchanged values being saved as NA. Moreover, the reasons for migration in the dataset were present as various columns which needed to be pivoted in order to be in the tidy data format.21 columns of reasons for migration were pivoted and before doing the same, the new total number of rows and columns were calculated. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #pivoting data #sanity check #original rows=1875 #original columns=32 #number of columns to pivot=21 #expected rows rows=1875*21 print("Expected number of rows:") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Expected number of rows:" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rows ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 39375 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # expected columns col=(32-21)+2 print("Expected number of columns:") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Expected number of columns:" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} col ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 13 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mig3<-pivot_longer(mig3, 12:32, names_to = "Reason for Migration", values_to = "Number of People") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error in `loc_validate()`: ! Can't subset columns past the end. ℹ Locations 30, 31, and 32 don't exist. ℹ There are only 29 columns. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} dim(mig3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 800 29 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mig3<-mig3%>% separate("Reason for Migration",into=c("Reason", "Value"), sep="_") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error in `vec_as_location2_result()`: ! Can't extract columns that don't exist. ✖ Column `Reason for Migration` doesn't exist. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mig3<-mig3%>% mutate(Reason_Mig = case_when( Reason == "work" ~ "Work", Reason == "busi" ~ "Business", Reason == "educ" ~ "Education", Reason == "mar" ~ "Marriage", Reason == "afterbirth" ~ "After birth", Reason == "withhh" ~ "With the household", Reason == "others" ~ "Others" )) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error in `mutate()`: ! Problem while computing `Reason_Mig = case_when(...)`. Caused by error: ! object 'Reason' not found ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mig3<-mig3%>% mutate(Value_Mig = case_when( Value == "t" ~ "Total", Value == "m" ~ "Male", Value == "f" ~ "Female", )) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ``` Error in `mutate()`: !
